name: Howard Johnson Inn New Stanton

reviews.text: Older property with larger than average rooms. Staff was very helpful and the place was spotless. Front desk staff were very helpful. Standard assortment of TV channels, but the wireless internet was down for repairs - not a big deal to us. Breakfast was free and was okay for cereal and rolls. The "Eat'N Park" next door offers a discount with your room key and has good food and great service. This was our second stay at this location and we'll be back!
reviews.title: Great place to stop!

likes.liked: — Very clean and just off the turnpike.

reviews.text: I always wanted to stay at this Howard Johnson Inn because sooner or later it will be bulldozed and replaced with a cookie-cutter motel. Traveling the east coast corridor between NJ and Florida in the late 1960’s/early 1970’s, I remember the orange roofed restaurants next door to the HJ Lodge or Inn. The rooms were always huge and there was a patio or balcony with 2 lounge chairs. The pool was Olympic sized and we could look forward to a decent meal and ice cream for dessert.
reviews.title: Original HoJo

likes.liked: — comfortable bed, cold a/c, quiet, expanded cable
likes.disliked: — no internet connection and no remedy to fix it

reviews.title: Nice place, great value, friendly staff
reviews.text: Today, usually staying at a HoJo you just never know what your going to get. HoJo is just a name today - a franchise with easy standards to follow. You can take the name and plaster it on any cookie-cutter motel you want to. Honestly, the corporate company that owns the franchise system should just retire the HJ name because its not the same anymore. I will go farther and retire Ramada Inn and Days Inn - names that meant quality in their glory years under private ownership.

reviews.title: Good value... excellent pool.
reviews.text: The New Stanton, Pa Howard Johnson motel - built in 1960 is pretty old already. Don’t get me wrong, it’s not falling apart, it was clean, and I didn’t notice any long term residents. The owner was pleasant and we talked about the golden years of HJ. I requested a king room far from the pool. My room had a microwave and mini-fridge, cable with 78 channels and the old style table and 2 chairs. Yes I’m spoiled since I rather have either a recliner or lounge chair with ottoman. The old Westinghouse air conditioner kept the room cold, though a bit noisy for some I rather have it that way to drown out noise - which there was none even though the place was packed. Original HJ motels like New Stanton’s were very sound-proof, constructed of cement walls and floors. Everything worked except the free wireless internet. The signal was there but it just didn’t connect. I called the front desk and he agreed that there was a problem but it was something beyond his control. If I was staying more than one night it would have been a problem for me. My room also had a patio with 2 plastic chairs.

aka: Howard Johnson Inn New Stanton Hotel New Stanton
